TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HotSpotMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the behaviors of a object in an control when the is clicked.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode> enumeration represents the behaviors that you can apply to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object within an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> properties use these enumeration values to set the behavior of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object when it is clicked. If both properties are set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property specified on each individual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object takes precedence over the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property on the control.
If you specify `HotSpotMode.NotSet` for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of an individual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> gets its behavior from the containing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. In this scenario, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A> property is either `NotSet` or no value is specified, the default behavior is to navigate to a URL.
> [!NOTE] > If an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control's behavior is not specified using either the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects it contains, by default the behavior is `HotSpotMode.Navigate`. In addition, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects that an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control contains are set to `HotSpotMode.NotSet` and no value is specified for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, the default behavior is `HotSpotMode.Navigate`.
If you specify `HotSpotMode.Navigate` for either the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, the page navigates to a URL when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> is clicked. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Image.NavigateUrl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.NavigateUrl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to specify the URL to navigate to.
If you specify `HotSpotMode.PostBack` for either the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, the page generates a postback to the server when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> is clicked. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.PostBackValue%2A> property to specify a name for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object. This name will be passed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMapEventArgs> event data when the postback event occurs. When a postback <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> is clicked, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.Click> event is raised. To programmatically control the actions performed when a postback <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> is clicked, provide an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.Click> event.
If you specify `HotSpotMode.Inactive` for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object does not have any behavior when it is clicked. You can use this value to create an inactive hot spot within a larger active hot spot. This option is provided to allow you to create more complex hot spot zones within an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control.
To create an inactive area within an active hot spot, you must specify the inactive hot spot before the active one in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. For example, the following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> defines an active ring by specifying an inactive circular hot spot within a larger active circular hot spot:
``` <asp:ImageMap ID="SaturnImage" ImageUrl="~/saturn.PNG" runat="server" OnClick="SaturnImage_Click"> <asp:CircleHotSpot AlternateText="planet" HotSpotMode=PostBack PostBackValue="planet" Radius=40 X=100 Y=100 />
<asp:CircleHotSpot HotSpotMode=Inactive Radius=60 X=100 Y=100 /> <asp:CircleHotSpot AlternateText="rings" HotSpotMode=PostBack PostBackValue="rings" Radius=80 X=100 Y=100 /> </asp:ImageMap> ```
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode> enumeration values to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. The page contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control that contains two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RectangleHotSpot> objects. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set to `HotSpotMode.PostBack`, which causes the page to post back to the server each time a user clicks one of the hot spot regions. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property is not set on either of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RectangleHotSpot> objects because they get their behavior from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpotMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-aspx-csharp[ImageMap.HotSpotMode1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.HotSpotMode1/CS/imagemap.hotspotmode1cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[ImageMap.HotSpotMode1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ImageMap.HotSpotMode1/VB/imagemap.hotspotmode1vb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode Inactive = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The does not have any behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode Navigate = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The uses the behavior set by the control's property. If the control does not define the behavior, the object navigates to a URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotMode PostBack = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The generates a postback to the server.
